Flexblocks

Use what you have learned about CSS Flexbox to stack the blocks in different patterns. Use the :nth-child() function to target specific blocks.

  1. Use the display property to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  2. Use the display and flex-direction properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  3. Use the display, justify-content and flex-wrap properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  4. Use the display, justify-content, and align-items properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  5. Use the display, justify-content, flex-wrap, and the flex-grow properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  6. Use the display, flex-direction, width, and the flex-grow properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  7. Use the display and margin properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.

  8. Use the display, flex-wrap, and flex-basis properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern. Hint: The calc() should be used to adjust for the 2px margin around each block. How to use calc() "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/calc()"
    .

  9. Use the display, flex-wrap, flex-grow, order, and flex-basis properties to stack the blocks in the following pattern.
